discussion.content: B is correct as no LACP can be used down to virtual switch

questions.question_text: A cloud provider must make a pair of firewalls available to all tenants. Each tenant defines its own service graph. Where should the Layer 4 to Layer 7 service be configured to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. common tenant
D should be the correct answer.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A customer experiences resource overconsumption on one of its border leaf switches. Which action should be taken to reduce the consumption on this switch?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Border is at the edge of the fabric, thus removing unnecesary computing load by learning remote endpoints make sense

questions.question_text: Which feature should be disabled on a bridge domain when a default gateway for endpoints is on an external device instead of a Cisco ACI bridge domain SVI?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
unicast routing disabled, because the gateway is outside of the aci fabric

Selected Answer: A
A is a
I think the correct answer is A

choices.C: Create the contract in the user tenant with the scope set to Global and exported to other tenants
choices.B: Create the contract in the common tenant with the scope set to Tenant
choices.A: Create the contract in the user tenant with the scope set to VRF and exported to other tenants
choices.D: Create the contract in the common tenant with the scope set to Global

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
tenant level is simply local tenant, no inter tenant behavior for this scope

questions.question_text: An engineer created a Cisco ACI environment in which multiple tenants reuse the same contract. The requirement is to prevent inter-tenant communication. Which action meets this requirement?
